questions.question: I prefer riding my bicycle ………………………. driving the car.
She enjoys ……………………………. time in her garden.
questions.description: Enjoy should be followed by an ing form, not an infinitive.

questions.question: I am not used to …………………………… alone.
questions.description: The to in used to is a preposition. Use an ing form after a preposition.

questions.question: Would you mind ……………………………. for a minute?
questions.description: Use an ing form after mind.

questions.question: That resort ………………………………… be a palace.
questions.description: Used to can indicate past states. Would cannot be used to express this idea.

questions.question: I still remember ………………….. her for the first time.
questions.description: When the reference is to past time, use an ing form after remember.

questions.question: I would rather you ………………………….. me alone.
questions.description: Use a past verb after would rather to refer to the present.

questions.question: It is high time you ……………………………. a job.
questions.description: Use a past tense after high time to refer to the present.

questions.question: I forgot …………………… him on his birthday.
I asked her ………………………………. she was interested.
questions.description: Either if or whether can be used to introduce an Yes/No question.

questions.question: Let him ................................ if he wants to.
questions.description: Let is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: I am ……………………………….. a call from my brother.
questions.description: It should be I am expecting a call from my brother or I am waiting for a call from my brother.
